data.title: [PDF] A Celebration of 2026E Graduates - Amherst College
data.snippet: Words by Janet Barton Morgan 2026E Graduates Beatrice Agbi Queens, New York English Miro Babin Amherst, Massachusetts Computer Science Martin Osei Asiamah Jr. Bronx, New York Psychology Laura Braithwaite Milton, Massachusetts French Sam Callahan San Antonio, Texas Computer Science Marius Cotorobai Chisinau, Moldova Computer Science Richa Carmel D’Mello Goa, India Computer Science Gerald Dhima Fier, Albania Computer Science Grant Decker Denver, Colorado Political Science Maxine Dobbs Laurel, Mississippi Computer Science Casie Eifrig Lemont, Pennsylvania /Berlin, Germany Architectural Studies Eleeza Faraday Neptune, New Jersey English Tyler Fields Clermont, Florida Biochemistry & Biophysics Patrick Forbes Truckee, California Anthropology Naomi Alem Habtu New York, New York Anthropology [...] DECEMBER 13, 2025 A Celebration of 2026E Graduates Order of Program WELCOME Michael A. Elliott ’92, President “HYMN TO AMHERST” Performed by the Amherst College Glee Club Led by Alexandra Conklin ’25 REMARKS Michael A. Elliott ’92, President READING OF GRADUATE NAMES Martha M. Umphrey, Provost and Dean of the Faculty Reception to follow at the Science Center Living Room HISTORY OF THE E CELEBRATION The E Celebration is an annual tradition at Amherst College that celebrates students who complete their degree requirements in the fall semester. For some, the E Celebration is a precursor to the Commencement events; for others, the event is the culmination of their years at Amherst College. At the E Celebration, each student receives a tassel and a 2026E Conway Cane. [...] Naomi Alem Habtu New York, New York Anthropology Steven Holmquist Stony Brook, New York Computer Science Xenel Islam Baltimore, Maryland Art and the History of Art Shayna Klainberg Brooklyn, New York German 2026E Graduates Angelina Suarez Houston, Texas Education Studies Raffay Tabassum Lahore, Pakistan Mathematics Mayuka Takiguchi Saitama, Japan Environmental Studies Joseph Hampton Thomas Great Falls, Virginia Mathematics Robyn Valverde Savannah, Georgia Sociology Philip Curtis White Wilmington, North Carolina Economics Ally Woodford Springfield, Massachusetts Sociology and Spanish Zakaria Shenwari Dearborn, Michigan Neuroscience Elvis Mujić Brčko, Bosnia and Herzegovina Philosophy Leydn McEvoy Newton, Massachusetts English

data.title: [PDF] Technological drive from past to future? | ICOHTEC
data.snippet: Greenpeace and its Anti-nuclear Campaigns in Brazil, 1991 – 2011 Ph.D. candidate Marly Kamioji Science, Energy and Knowledge: An Analysis of the Scientific Literature on the Synthetic Fuels Production Technologies in the 1970s and 1980s in the United States Dr. Francesco Gerali A Positive Example of the Operation of Binomial Political Authority: Powerful Technologies and Renewable Energies in the Period of Totalitarianism in Romania Professor Victoria Cotorobai S2C Tourism – What Can History of Technology Contribute? Location: H 1 4 Organiser: Stefan Poser Chair: Per Lundin Touristic Space for a Deprived Period: Showcasing a Chapter of the History of Iron Technology in Ancient Gaya/Kaya, South Korea Professor Constantin Canavas Confronting Class: The American Motel in Early Post-war [...] in the History of Romanian Railways: Context, Causes and Consequences Researcher Eduard Cotorobai Professor Liviu Alexandru Sofonea Professor Victoria Cotorobai W3C Plastics, Emotions and Consumer Society Location: H 1 4 Organisers: Maria Elvira Callapez, Günter Lattermann and Stefan Poser Chair: Stefan Poser Historic Surrogates (“Ersatzstoffe”) and the Image of Plastics Today Dr. Günter Lattermann Building the History of the Portuguese Plastic Industry through Material Testimonies Dr. Inês Soares Professor Susana Sá Professor Joana Ferreira Plastics Hand in Hand with Consumers Dr. Maria Elvira Callapez Graduate student Sara Marques da Cruz Graduate student Marta Martins Neto 51 W3D Industrial Strategies from the Past to the Future Location: H 1 1 Organiser: PC Chair: Lars Bluma Two [...] the Bunge Prize awarded by the German Chemical and Physical Societies, and the holder of the Sarton Medal and Sarton Professorship at the University of Ghent. Holder of a doctorate in the History and Sociology of Science from the University of Pennsylvania, he has published extensively on the histories of applied science, chemistry, and biotechnology, including his books The Uses of Life: A History of Biotechnology (1993) and Penicillin: Triumph and Tragedy (2007). His current research is on the history of the concept of “applied science” in the public sphere, over two centuries and he is also part of the international HoNESt project, which seeks to understand the changing engagement of societies with nuclear energy, and how the nuclear energy sector has engaged with societies. 18 Special

data.title: [PDF] Arden University Graduation Ceremony
data.snippet: Petru-Alexandru Anitei Maria Arsovska Isata Bah Amar Kanta Baidya Casandra Banu Victor Barros John David Anthony Barrow Maria Buga Muhammed Busuulwa Male Dorina Ileana Calota Mihalcea Mohammad Jamal Chowdhury Daniela Cotorobai Yawavi Dakou Cerasela Mihaela Dascalu Gabriel Davor Diarra Diallo Daniel Mihai Dijmarescu Susan Dorkin Daniel Dragusin Twalib Sosa Dumba Jesica Etumudon Maria Foller Denitsa Borislavova Georgieva Alina Grecu Elena Andreea Grigore Muheb Ullah Hasan Emran Hasnat Delwar Hussain Md Afai Hussain Raluca Georgiana Iacob Teddy Yordanova Ivanova Anayatula Karemi Ramona-Izabela Kovacs Angelika Kulesza Ludmila Nicoleta Lica Zohirul Islam Liton Cicerone Eduard Marola Babul Miah Mahafuzur Rahman Mohammad Khanam Muhammad Naqash Mujahid Maharun Nasa Rosemary Nelson-Ndubuka Mihaela [...] On behalf of the Board of Directors of Arden University I would like to welcome you all – graduands, staff, and guests – to today's graduation ceremony, and congratulate all our graduands on their success. A graduation ceremony is a rite of passage which marks a significant milestone in your life. It celebrates the hard work and dedication you have invested in your programme of study and allows you to feel great pride in your achievements. I hope that you will enjoy your day and remember it for many years to come. You have now joined a growing community of Arden University alumni, a community which I hope you will take great pride in being a part of. I am proud to be associated with Arden University and the values it stands for. We believe there is no single right path to a university [...] Darari Abdulkdaer Hassan Piotr Krzysztof Okninski Timothy Oluremi Olalude Olubunmi Bianca Pintilie Vasile Percic Dragomir Nikolaev Petrov Joshua Preston Mohammad Faisal Qazi Natasha Simone Simms Maria Tomas Asad Yousaf Bachelor of Science with Honours Computing Godwin Osemelu Afobhokhan Hassam Najam Abdullah Al Ghazal Kaukab Asam Florentina Banea Mahir Ahmed Chowdhury Jake Matthew Clowery Patricia Claudia De Oliveira Figueira Pinto Onyebuchi Denis Egbula Emily-Jane Heaton Tamas Horog Violeta Titova Ivanova Maham Kashif Jeewan Khadka Waqar Razzaq Khan Jennifer Tracey Lidbury Adrian-Florentin Lilcu Faris Ahmad Lodhi George Mihai Marius-Alexandru Nechita Rafael Pantoja Perez Neli Kamenova Rangelova Tweneboah Kwadwo Sarfo Cristina Sima Frankie Sparkes Naomi Elaine Stonier Aali Tauqeer Syed
